topic.title: Adding an Edit Link in Your Interface

keywords.indexterm: Oxygen XML Web Author ComponentAdd Edit link in your interface
Add Edit link in your interface

body.p: can be launched to edit a file by simply following a link with a carefully built target. The base URL for the Edit link used to open the Web Author is the URL that you see in the browser when the Dashboard page is opened.

example.title: The base URL for oXygen XML Web Author demo deployment

body.p: The information about the file to open and the options used to load the file can be specified as URL parameters:

row.entry: The OXY-URL of the file to be opened.
For DITA files, the OXY-URL of the DITA Map to use as a context for resolving keys.

dlentry.dd: Whether or not changes are tracked depend on the server settings.
The changes are tracked by default but the user is able to disabled it.
The changes are tracked and the user cannot accept or reject changes made by others.

body.p:
The OXY-URL uses a custom schema according to the file storage system the file comes from.
GitHub The URLs have the following format:github://getFileContent/<user>/<repo>/<branch>/path/to/file.dita
Git The URLs have the following format:github://getFileList/<encoded-repo-http-url>/<branch>/path/to/file.dita
where encoded-repo-http-url is the http URL of the git repository (for example: https://user@bitbucket.org/user/flowers.git).
WebDAV The URLs have the following format:webdav-https://dav.box.com/dav/path/to/file.dita
where the WebDAV URL of the file is: https://dav.box.com/dav/path/to/file.dita.
SharePoint The URL of the file is the SharePoint file URL, prefixed with spo-.
REST The URLs have the following format:rest://<server-id>/path/to/file.dita The format can be further specified by the implementer of the REST API.
